definitions: To provide a computer or other machine with coded instructions for the automatic performance of a particular task.
To arrange for an event or activity to happen at a particular time or to be included in a plan.
To cause a person or animal to behave in a particular way through training or conditioning.
examples: She will program the robot to assemble the parts.
The concert is programmed for next Saturday.
The experiment programmed the mice to avoid the light.
